magpie.data

Class Dataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.data.Dataset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Citable, Commandable, Options, Printable, Savable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatasetHelper, DatasetOutput, MultiPropertyDataset

    public class Dataset
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Printable, Savable, Options, Commandable, Citable
    Provides a basic storage container for data-mining tasks. Must be filled with entries that are subclasses of BaseEntry

    To implement a new Dataset, you first need to create an extension of BaseEntry that represents the new kind of data. Then, you need to overload the following operations:

    • getEntry(int) - Might be useful to overload with an operation that returns entry type associated with this model
    • addEntry(java.lang.String) - Call the constructor to the associated entry type
    • calculateAttributes() - Compute any new attributes for for class
    • emptyClone() - Create clone of dataset. Cloning entries is handled in clone(), which does not need to be modified.

    Usage: *No options to set*

    Implemented Commands:

    add <entries...> - Add entries to a dataset
    entries...: Strings describing entries to be added

    combine $<dataset> - Add entries from another dataset
    dataset: Dataset to combine with this dataset

    add $<dataset> [-force] - Add entries from another dataset
    dataset: Dataset to be merged with this one
    -force: Optional: Whether to force merge if attributes / classes / properties are different
    If attributes, classes, or properties are different, attributes and class values in new entries (i.e., those from the other dataset) will be deleted and properties will be merged

    add $<dataset> [-force] - Add entries from another dataset
    dataset: Dataset to be merged with this one
    -force: Optional: Whether to force merge if attributes / classes / properties are different
    If attributes, classes, or properties are different, attributes and class values in new entries (i.e., those from the other dataset) will be deleted and properties will be merged

    <output> = clone [-empty] - Create a copy of this dataset
    -empty: Do not copy entries from dataset into clone

    combine $<dataset> - Add all entries from another dataset
    dataset: Dataset to merge with this one. It will remain unchanged.

    filter <include|exclude> <method> [<options...>] - Run dataset through a filter
    include|exclude: Whether to include/exclude only entries that pass the filter
    method: Filtering method. Name of a BaseDatasetFilter ("?" to print available methods)
    options...: Options for the filter

    generate <method> [>options<] - Generate new entries
    method: Name of a BaseEntryGenerator. ("?" for options)
    options: Any options for the entry generator

    match $<dataset> <num> - Find most similar entries in this dataset
    dataset: Dataset containing entries to be matched
    num: Number of closest entries to print
    Prints the most similar entries in this dataset to those in the dataset passed as the argument.

    modify <method> [<options>] - Modify the dataset
    method: How to modify dataset. Name of a BaseDatasetModifier. ("?" to print available methods)
    options: Any options for the dataset

    import <filename> [<options...>] - Import data by reading a file
    filename: Name of file to import data from
    options...: Any options used when parsing this dataset (specific to type of Dataset)

    rank <number> <maximum|minimum> <measured|predicted> <method> [<options>] - Print the top ranked entries based by some measure
    number: Number of top entries to print
    maximum|minimum: Whether to print entries with the largest or smallest objection function
    measured|predicted: Whether to use the measured or predicted values when calculation
    method: Object function used to rank entries. Name of a BaseEntryRanker ("?" for available methods)
    options...: Any options for the objective function

    <output> = split <number|fraction> - Randomly select and remove entries from dataset
    number|fraction: Either the fraction or number of entries to be removed
    output: New dataset containing randomly selected entries that were in this dataset

    <output> = subset <number|fraction> - Generate a random subset from this dataset
    number|fraction: Either the fraction or number of entries to select
    output: New dataset containing random selection from this dataset

    attributes - Print all attributes

    attributes expanders add <method> [<options...>] - Add an attribute expander to be run after generating attributes
    method: How to expand attributes. Name of a BaseAttributeExpander ("?" to print available methods)
    options...: Any options for the expansion method These expanders are designed to create new attributes based on existing ones.

    attributes expanders clear - Clear the current list of attribute expanders

    attributes expanders run - Run the currently-defined list of attribute expanders

    attributes generators add <method> [<options...>] - Add a new attribute generator to list of generators
    method: New generation method. Name of a BaseAttributeGenerator ("?" to print available methods)
    options...: Any options for the generator method These expanders are designed to create new attributes tailored for a specific application.

    attributes generators run - Run the currently-defined list of attribute expanders

    attributes generators clear - Clear the current list of attribute generators

    attributes generate - Generate attributes for each entry

    attributes rank <number> <method> [<options...>] - Rank attributes based on predictive power
    number: Number of top attributes to print
    method: Method used to rank attributes. Name of a BaseAttributeEvaluator ("?" to print available methods)
    options...: Options for the evaluation method.

    Implemented Print Commands:

    details - Print details about this class

    dist - Print distribution of entries between known classes

    Implemented Save Formats: TBD

    csv - Comma-separated value format.
    The value of each attribute and the measured class variable, if defined.

    arff - Weka's ARFF format.
    Requires that a measured value is available for the class variable of each entry.

    stats - Writes predicted and measured class variables.
    This is intended to allow an external program to evaluate model performance.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addEntries

        public void addEntries(Dataset otherDataset,
              boolean forceMerge)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Add entries from another dataset. If other dataset has different attributes or class attributes, you can force a merge between these datasets by deleting the attributes and classes from the other dataset.

        Entries will be cloned before adding them to this dataset.

        Parameters:
        otherDataset - Dataset to be added to this one
        forceMerge - Whether to force merge if attributes / class are different.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If datasets have different classes or attributes, and forceMerge is false.

      • matchEntries

        public java.util.List<BaseEntry> matchEntries(BaseEntry entry,
                                     int n)
        Find entries in this dataset with attributes closest to a user-provided entry. Measures distance using the L2 norm.
        Parameters:
        entry - Entry to be matched
        n - Number of top entries to list
        Returns:
        List of top entries

      • combine

        public void combine(Dataset d)
        Combine the data structure with another. Does not alter the other dataset. Assumes that the two dataset have the same attributes, and classes.

        Entries are not cloned when during combination.

        If you are looking to add entries from another dataset, also consider using addEntries(magpie.data.Dataset, boolean).

        Parameters:
        d - Dataset to be added

      • combine

        Combine the data structure with an array of other Datasets. Does not alter input Datasets.
        Parameters:
        d - Array of Datasets

      • partition

        public Dataset[] partition(int[] labels)
        Given a list of labels, separate Dataset into multiple subsets
        Parameters:
        labels - Label defining in which subset to label an entry
        Returns:
        Array of subsets of length max(label) + 1, where each member, i, contains entries with label[i] == i.

      • partition

        public Dataset[] partition(int[] labels,
                  int number)
        Given a list of labels, separate Dataset into multiple subsets (some may be empty)
        Parameters:
        labels - Label defining in which subset to label an entry
        number - Number subsets to produce, must be greater than max(labels)
        Returns:
        Array of subsets of length max(label), where each member, i, contains entries with label[i] == i.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A new dataset containing only the specified entries

      • splitForThreading

        public Dataset[] splitForThreading(int NThreads)
        Split for threading purposes. Does not worry about randomization, thread n contains all entries where [entry ID] % NThreads == 0.

        Example: 4 threads, thread 1 has entry #1, 5, 9, ...

        Parameters:
        NThreads - Number of subsets to create
        Returns:
        Array of equally-sized Dataset objects

      • splitIntoFolds

        public Dataset[] splitIntoFolds(int folds)
        Split the dataset into multiple folds for cross-validation, empties the original test set
        Parameters:
        folds - Number of folds
        Returns:
        Vector of independent test sets

      • transferToWeka

        public weka.core.Instances transferToWeka(boolean useClass,
                                 boolean useDiscreteClass)
        Convert to Weka Instances object, delete attribute information in each entry. This can be used to conserve memory when using Weka.
        Parameters:
        useClass - Whether to output class data. Note: If there is no measured class data and useDiscreteClass is true, value will be set to Zero. This allows the Instances to contain information about how many classes are available regardless of whether this Dataset contains any measurements.
        useDiscreteClass - Whether to treat class variable as discrete
        Returns:
        Dataset in Weka format
        See Also:
        restoreAttributes(weka.core.Instances)

      • restoreAttributes

        public void restoreAttributes(weka.core.Instances weka)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Restore attribute data to each entry.
        Parameters:
        weka - Weka object containing attribute information. Assumes last variable has class variable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        transferToWeka(boolean, boolean)

      • printAttributeDescription

        public java.lang.String printAttributeDescription(boolean htmlFormat)
        Print out description of attributes.

        Implementation Guide

        Subclasses should describe what kind of attributes are generated by default. If it uses a separate generator class, those are captured by the printDescription(boolean) section.

        Parameters:
        htmlFormat - Whether to print in HTML format
        Returns:
        Description of the attributes or an empty string ("") if there are no default attributes.

        Returns:
